response_parsed.title: Observing Microservices Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to utilize FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+, to observe microservices.
key_points: FastAPI's user-friendly syntax and intuitive type system
Built-in OpenAPI support for generating API documentation
Integration with popular databases (SQLAlchemy), testing frameworks (pytest, unittest), and web sockets (WebSocket)
Middlewares and Dependency Injection for modularizing code
Real-time data streaming using ASGI (Asynchronous Server Gateway Interface)
version_notes: FastAPI version 0.67.0+ is compatible with Python 3.12.
It's recommended to use the latest stable version for the best experience.
caveats: While FastAPI offers a lot of built-in features, it may require more configuration when working with microservices compared to monolithic applications.
Familiarity with ASGI is essential for implementing real-time data streaming.
